TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed PathDirection extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Indicates the hierarchical order in which navigation nodes are rendered for site-navigation controls.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The PathDirection enumeration is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapPath> control to specify the ordering used to render site map nodes. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapPath.PathDirection%2A> property is set to RootToCurrent, the navigation path is displayed in the most common way, from the top-most node to the current node, from left to right. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapPath.PathDirection%2A> is set to CurrentToRoot, the navigation path is displayed from the current node to the top-most node, from left to right.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to declaratively set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapPath.PathDirection%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapPath> in a Web Forms page.
